hero.title: From coffee farmer to your cup
hero.description: Almost 20 years ago we got to know the coffee farmers in Honduras. In 2018 we founded Café RICO to bring fair, organic coffee to Belgium.

intro.title: Rooted in Honduras
intro.description: The founders of Café RICO met almost 20 years ago in Honduras, where they worked with ecological farming and farmer organisations. In 2018 they founded Café RICO — Spanish for 'delicious' — to bring fair, organic specialty coffee directly from the farmer to Belgium.

eerlijk.title: Fair & Delicious
eerlijk.description: We partner with cooperative COMBRIFOL, representing 193 farming families in Honduras. Fair prices and training ensure every cup directly benefits the community.

ecologisch.title: Ecological
ecologisch.description: Our coffee carries the EU organic label and is certified by Mayacert. From cultivation to packaging: ecological and sustainable.

honduras.title: Honduras
honduras.description: Our beans grow in the Marcala region, an area with a protected designation of origin. At 1,350–1,850 metres altitude, the perfect microclimate for specialty coffee.

smaak.title: Taste
smaak.description: Fruity, lively acidity, citrus, peach, honey and a floral aftertaste. Scored 84 on the SCAA scale (Q-grader Tom Janssen) and 86 from the Marcala coffee council.

tom.name: Tom Janssen
tom.quote: Personally I find it a delicious coffee that certainly deserves to be showcased. A good full flavour, a touch of chocolate. Will appeal to many people.

lesly.name: Lesly Yohana Dominguez
lesly.quote: Harvesting coffee is not just men's work. We women find quality important and dedicate ourselves to careful work. So that our coffee becomes our pride!

process.title: Our process
process.description: Every step in the process contributes to the exceptional taste of our coffee.

pluk.title: Careful picking
pluk.description: Only ripe, deep-red coffee cherries are hand-picked.

wassen.title: Washing
wassen.description: The cherries are washed to remove the fruit pulp.

drogen.title: Drying
drogen.description: The beans dry in special drying tunnels to the perfect moisture level.

branden.title: Roasting in Belgium
branden.description: Locally roasted in small batches for optimal freshness and flavour.

kopje.title: Your cup
kopje.description: From Honduras to your kitchen — fair, organic and delicious.

bio.label: BE-BIO-02
bio.description: European organic label — certified organic farming

mayacert.description: Certified by Mayacert for sustainable agriculture

coffeeOne.question: What is specialty coffee?
coffeeOne.answer: Specialty coffee is single-origin coffee, unblended, scoring above 80 on the SCAA scale. Café RICO scores 84 on the SCAA scale, sourced from Marcala, Honduras.

coffeeTwo.question: What is the difference between light, medium, and dark roast?
coffeeTwo.answer: Light roast preserves fruity and floral origin notes, medium brings balance between origin character and caramel sweetness, and dark roast delivers a full body with chocolate and nutty tones. Filter and pour-over work best with light to medium, espresso with medium to dark.

coffeeThree.question: Is Honduras a coffee country?
coffeeThree.answer: Absolutely. Coffee accounts for over 3% of Honduras's GDP and 30% of agricultural production. It is the country's most important export product. Our coffee grows in the Marcala region at 1,350–1,850 metres altitude.

coffeeFour.question: What is a Q-grader?
coffeeFour.answer: A Q-grader is a trained coffee taster certified to professionally evaluate coffee on aroma, flavour, body, acidity and more. Our coffee has been graded by Q-grader Tom Janssen of OR Coffee.

coffeeFive.question: How is organic coffee decaffeinated?
coffeeFive.answer: Our decaf is 100% naturally decaffeinated using the CO2 method. This process takes place in Germany and uses no chemicals — only carbon dioxide under high pressure. This preserves the full flavour.

ordersOne.question: How fast is my order dispatched?
ordersOne.answer: Orders placed before 12:00 are roasted and shipped the same day.

ordersTwo.question: Can I change my order after placing it?
ordersTwo.answer: Updates are possible within two hours before it enters production.

ordersThree.question: How do I track my order?
ordersThree.answer: You'll receive a tracking link by email as soon as it leaves the atelier.

subscriptionsOne.question: Can I pause my subscription?
subscriptionsOne.answer: Yes, skip a delivery or pause whenever you need a break.

subscriptionsTwo.question: When am I billed for a subscription?
subscriptionsTwo.answer: Payment is processed two days before the scheduled roast.

subscriptionsThree.question: Can I switch grind size each delivery?
subscriptionsThree.answer: Absolutely—adjust the grind in your account before each shipment.

shippingOne.question: Which countries do you ship to?
shippingOne.answer: We deliver in Belgium, the Netherlands, Luxembourg, and Germany.

shippingTwo.question: What are the shipping fees?
shippingTwo.answer: Shipping is free from €35; otherwise the fee is €4.95.

shippingThree.question: How long does delivery take?
shippingThree.answer: Most parcels arrive within 1-2 business days after roasting.

faq.title: Answers to common questions
faq.description: Everything you need before you start.

one.question: Can I pause or cancel?
one.answer: Yes. Adjust your cadence or stop before the next roast.

two.question: When is my coffee roasted?
two.answer: Each batch is roasted right before shipping for peak aroma.

three.question: Can I switch between beans and ground?
three.answer: Absolutely. Change your grind between deliveries without extra cost.

four.question: What about shipping?
four.answer: Shipping details are confirmed before every delivery.
